Issues.Title: refactor: utilize type narrowing
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
At the moment we aren't utilizing Typescript's type narrowing capabilities (made possible by [type guards](http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/advanced-types.html#type-guards-and-differentiating-types)) in all contexts where it's currently available to us. This means that we are performing unnecessary explicit type conversions, which obviously is just bloating.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
Utilize all existing type narrowing.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: build: update to nodejs rules 0.38.2
Issues.Body:
Some changes in rules_nodejs providers folded into @angular/bazel package:
* `NodeModuleSources` renamed to `NpmPackageInfo` and now loaded from `//internal/common:npm_package_info.bzl`
* `collect_node_modules_aspect` renamed to `node_modules_aspect`
* new JS provider `JSNamedModuleInfo` now available and ng_module provides it using the `js_named_module_info` factory function
* sources_aspect has also been removed so the use of the `node_sources` legacy provider has been replaced with `JSNamedModuleInfo`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: update to nodejs rules 0.38.2" (#33073)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
 The issue is caused by package @angular/router I believe
Whichever package loads in zone-evergreen.js


### Is this a regression?

We started seeing the security error when we upgraded to Angular 8 and Node 10.15.2


### Description
Edge has a privacy setting where it will block all cookies in your browser.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3452495/66517302-be966780-ea97-11e9-89c6-790fb5a2c404.png)

When used, we are seeing seeing these errors:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3452495/66517518-1df47780-ea98-11e9-8e19-c016a13e9659.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3452495/66517565-34023800-ea98-11e9-9fd5-a25585022507.png)

We are only seeing this error in Edge, versions 18.18362-latest
This error seems to be affecting the site navigation. Initial page load is fine and cmpts work correctly, but when trying to navigate to another page, the app fails to load and we are left with are static header/footer.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
- Run angular 8 project with node 10.15.2
- Have a homepage and secondary page cmpts that the homepage links to utilizing angular router.
- Open Edge and set your privacy setting to block all cookies
- Load homepage, click on link to secondary page
- App should not load the secondary page cmpt


## üî• Exception or Error

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3452495/66517565-34023800-ea98-11e9-9fd5-a25585022507.png)


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 8

**Angular Dependencies:**
"@angular/animations": "^8.2.2",
 "@angular/cdk": "^8.1.3",
"@angular/common": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/compiler": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/core": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/forms": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/material": "^8.1.3",
"@angular/platform-browser": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~8.2.2",
"@angular/router": "~8.2.2",      


**Anything else relevant?**
***Only seeing this error in Edge:***
versions 18.18362-latest

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): do not always accept `undefined` for directive inputs
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, the template type checker would always allow a
value of type `undefined` to be passed into a directive's inputs, even
if the input's type did not allow for it. This was due to how the type
constructor for a directive was generated, where a `Partial` mapped
type was used to allow for inputs to be unset. This essentially
introduces the `undefined` type as acceptable type for all inputs.

This commit removes the `Partial` type from the type constructor, which
means that we can no longer omit any properties that were unset.
Instead, any properties that are not set will still be included in the
type constructor call, having their value assigned to `any`.

Before:

```typescript
class NgForOf<T> {
  static ngTypeCtor<T>(init: Partial<Pick<NgForOf<T>,
    'ngForOf'|'ngForTrackBy'|'ngForTemplate'>>): NgForOf<T>;
}

NgForOf.ngTypeCtor(init: {ngForOf: ['foo', 'bar']});
```

After:

```typescript
class NgForOf<T> {
  static ngTypeCtor<T>(init: Pick<NgForOf<T>,
    'ngForOf'|'ngForTrackBy'|'ngForTemplate'>): NgForOf<T>;
}

NgForOf.ngTypeCtor(init: {
  ngForOf: ['foo', 'bar'],
  ngForTrackBy: null as any,
  ngForTemplate: null as any,
});
```

This change only affects generated type check code, the generated
runtime code is not affected.

Fixes #32690
Resolves FW-1606
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): do not always accept `undefined` for directive inputs" (#33066)

Issues.Title: perf(docs-infra): various issues affecting performance of angular.io
Issues.Body:
This is a list of issues that have been found to affect performance of angular.io and need further investigation. (Capturing what we have found out so far for future reference.)

> NOTE 1: Most of the issues are not angular.io specific and would affect all similar apps.
> NOTE 2: The issues don't seems to be VE or Ivy specific.

Jira issue: [FW-1616][1]

**Context**
While debugging an unrelated bug in #32923 (turning on Ivy for angular.io), I noticed too many change detection runs (~250! in some cases) while navigating to `/guide/router` (a looong guide with lots of custom elements (193, 10 of which are `MatTabGroup`s)).

**Problems**
@pkozlowski-opensource profiled the app ([sample recording][2]) and found out it takes several seconds (~4-8s :scream:) to fully load the `/guide/router` page. The time is mostly spent in JS and forced layouts (:scream: :scream:).

The main problems seem to be the following:

- [ ] _Several forced layouts during JS execution._
    **Source:** `MatTabGroup`/`MatTab` components (`material`), `TocComponent` (`aio/`)
    **Related issues:** angular/components#17317

- [ ] _Several timers (as a result of scheduling macrotasks in some RxJS observable)._
    **Source:** `MatTab` component (`material`)

- [ ] _Several change detection runs triggered in `requestAnimationFrame()` calls._
    **Source:** `@angular/elements` change detection (at least 1 per element _instance_ (often more due to a bug - see related issues)) (`elements`)
    **Related issues:** #33059, #33060

fyi @pkozlowski-opensource 

[1]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1616
[2]: https://github.com/angular/components/files/3698146/aio_mat_tab_forced_layout.json.zip


[FW-1616]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1616
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "perf(docs-infra): various issues affecting performance of angular.io" (#33063)

Issues.Title: elements: no coalescing of change detection invocations across instances
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/elements.


### Is this a regression?

No.


### Description

While Angular custom elements do coalesce change detection invocations per element instance (see [scheduleDetectChanges()][1]), there is no coalescing across other instances of the same element or other elements (even for those on the same injector or component tree.

This results in too many CDs on pages/routes with many custom elements and can negatively affect performance. (This is the case for example in https://angular.io/guide/router, which has ~200 custom elements.)


### Anything else relevant?

Related issues: #23813, #33059


[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L206-L215
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "elements: no coalescing of change detection invocations across instances" (#33060)

Issues.Title: elements: too many change detection runs during initialization
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/elements.


### Is this a regression?

No.


### Description

During custom element initialization (i.e. [initializeComponent()][1]), the default `NgElementStrategy`, [ComponentNgElementStrategy][2], (transitively) may call [setInputValue()][3], which in turn calls [scheduleDetectChanges()][4]. Right after, `initializeComponent()` calls [detectChanges()][5].

However, despite CD being run synchrinously after `setInputValue()`, the scheduled, asynchronous CD (scheduled inside `setInputValue()` will still run.

This results in two CDs per Angular custom element instance, which can negatively affect initial page loads or route transitions for pages/routes with many custom elements. (This is the case for example in https://angular.io/guide/router, which has ~200 custom elements.)

**Possible solution:**
I think it would be reasonable to cancel scheduled CD, if CD is triggered eariler than scheduled.

(See the reproduction below for a demo of the fix.)


### üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngelements-issue-33059?file=src/app/app.component.ts


### Anything else relevant?

Related issues: #23813, #33060


[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L146-L162
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L45
[3]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L168
[4]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L139
[5]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9f0c549bc/packages/elements/src/component-factory-strategy.ts#L158
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "elements: too many change detection runs during initialization" (#33059)

Issues.Title: 3rdpartylicenses.txt - optional generation, documentation and fitness for purpose
Issues.Body:
I think this is a combination of a **bug report**, plus a possible **feature request** and **change to the documentation**.

The issue is around `3rdpartylicenses.txt`, how (and whether) it's generated during a build, and whether it's actually fit for purpose.

By default (at least when you do a production build via `ng build --prod`), all license information from third party JS dependencies is stripped out, de-duplicated, and moved to `3rdpartylicenses.txt`. This is all well and good! This file is located in the same directory as `index.html` etc., thus making it available (assuming you deploy the whole directory or its contents) at the root level of your application.

What's not so clear to me though - and this doesn't seem to be covered in the Angular documentation - is whether or not this actually satisfies the license requirements, e.g. "The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software" - from the MIT License.

Do I have to publicise the existence of `3rdpartylicenses.txt`, or make it in some way directly accessible to users from my web application, in order to satisify the requirement that it "shall be included in ... the Software"? This seems overly burdensome on me though, so **what other - alternative - options do I have? And can this please be covered in the documentation?**

At the moment, it is possible to prevent the generation of `3rdpartylicenses.txt` by supplying `--extractLicenses=false` to the build command. *However* - and this is where the bug report comes in - this ***doesn't** actually prevent the license details from being stripped out of the minified JS! Instead, it just prevents `3rdpartylicenses.txt` from being created!* (at least, this is the case when I just tested it in Angular 7 anyway...)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "3rdpartylicenses.txt - optional generation, documentation and fitness for purpose" (#33056)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): i18n - turn on legacy message-id support by default
Issues.Body:
For v9 we want the migration to the new i18n to be as
simple as possible.

Previously the developer had to positively choose to use
legacy messsage id support in the case that their translation
files had not been migrated to the new format by setting the
`legacyMessageIdFormat` option in tsconfig.json to the format
of their translation files.

Now this setting has been changed to `enableI18nLegacyMessageFormat`
as is a boolean that defaults to `true`. The format is then read from
the `i18nInFormat` option, which was previously used to trigger translations
in the pre-ivy angular compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): i18n - turn on legacy message-id support by default" (#33053)

Issues.Title: Angular Router URL array parameters doesnt get updated on navigate
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? I dont know if this did work in previous versions ### Description Appending items to a URL parameter doesn¬¥t work as expected. The parameter in the URL is an list/ array where items can be added or removed. Before it is possible to write an updated version of the list for append oder delete operations the current state of the parameters has to be read from the URL. The minimal reproductions shows that setting the parameters doesn¬¥t affect the URL. Only on the first call (click of the button) the URL does change. I belive that the problem might correlate with the fact that the list itself is read from the URL directly before in my example. For example: If I¬¥d click the button in the example 3 times i would expect the URL to look like this: https://angular-slnewb.stackblitz.io/?myParameter=0&myParameter=1&myParameter=2 But instead it does look like this: https://angular-slnewb.stackblitz.io/?myParameter=0 only element that has been added at first appears in the URL. If you check the console output it shows the value of the parameter that should have been written to the URL: ["0", "1", "2"] And it contains all three elements. Writing another parameter to the URL afterwards will update the URL with the missing elements from the array aswell There are a few possible workarounds for this issue. 1. Writing a comma-separated string to the URL instead of the array and splitting it when reading the parameter. Check: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-negcsk 2. Having an extra list that represents the items in die URL. This way it is not necessary to read from the URL before adding items to the list. A problem with this solution is that it is necessary initialize the additional list when the component loads. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-slnewb ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: refactor(docs-infra): remove template type-checking work-around for `*ngFor`
Issues.Body:
Before #31371, the `ngFor` typing issue could be worked around by using the non-null assertion operator (`!`) in templates:

```diff
-*ngFor="let section of filteredSections | async"
+*ngFor="let section of (filteredSections | async)!"
```

Once #31371 is released (i.e. in v9.0.0-next.10 or v9.0.0-rc.0), we should update angular.io and remove such work-arounds (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/32980#discussion_r331797547).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "refactor(docs-infra): remove template type-checking work-around for `*ngFor`" (#33051)

Issues.Title: Complete screen is broken due to backtick(`) in Custom component
Issues.Body:
I have created one custom component. By mistake backtick typed in code due to which complete screen have broken As shown in example below
<ng-select [items]="people$ | async"`
           bindLabel="name"
           autofocus
           bindValue="id"
           [(ngModel)]="selectedPersonId">
</ng-select>
Due to backtick(`) complete screen screen have broken.
Below is the Error message which i am getting.

Error: Failed to execute 'setAttribute' on 'Element': '`' is not a valid attribute name.
From this error message it is difficult to understand what went wrong.
There should be proper error message or It should be handled properly

Issues.Title: Backport additional differential loading improvements
Issues.Body: This also provides a workaround for an issue wherein larger files (10MB+) currently cause an excessive amount of memory usage during AST processing.  This is currently being remedied upstream.  However for the current time period, this change allows for successful builds without increasing the Node.js memory limit.

Issues.Title: NPM Installation Issues GOOGLE WONT FIX ITS OWN ISSUES
Issues.Body:
I'm not behind a proxy - I've tried a multiplicity of things. Including setting the proxy to null, and completely uninstalling Angular CLI. Didn't help now stuck. It appears that this IP address has a degraded status. - [X ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes needed to do an update after macOS Catalina install and move to ZSH. ### Description The package times out at different intervals - I can ping the IP address associated to the NPM package without issue. Issues.Title: feat-fix(appsScript): builds do not support appsscript deployment
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
I would like to host an angular project as a web interface for a Google Suite plugin. To do so, I need to host the code on Google Appsscript.

To try and do that, I created an angular project, ran:
```bash
ng build  --prod --output-hashing none
mkdir appsscript
cd appsscript
clasp login # Login to your Google account
clasp create "angular"
cp -a ../dist/. . # Copy dist files to appsscript project
clasp push
```

And I get errors from appsscript like:
> Syntax error: Missing ; before statement. line: 1 file: appsscript/main-es2015

or
> Syntax error: Property "useDeprecatedSynchronousErrorHandling" already defined in this object literal. line: 1 file: appsscript/main-es5


Which as far as I understand, means that appsscript thinks this compiled code is not strict enough.


### Describe the solution you'd like
A build option with "strict" output code


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've tried to compile to ES3, which is a JS version that appsscript should be able to analyze (although I'm running this in the browser eventually), 
But I get:
>  'Syntax error: Invalid property ID. line: 133 file: sheets/main',

which refers to this part of the code:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5757359/66480565-a29ac200-eaa7-11e9-9106-b8b49420021b.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat-fix(appsScript): builds do not support appsscript deployment" (#15799)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): add migration to add new i18n options for Ivy
Issues.Body: This migration will update current projects by adding the `i18n` project level option and add `translateLocales` option in the server and browser builder configurations when both `i18nLocale` and `i18nFile` are defined.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@schematics/angular): add migration to add new i18n options for Ivy" (#15795)

# üöÄ Feature request
To include folder for modules in the project initial structure at ng new assistant, for lazy loading.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When I create a new project, I generate a principal module (home, explore, etc...) with a routing module, components, pipes, etc...

### Describe the solution you'd like
In the initial project, to include "/src/app/modules/name.module.ts". Routing optional, name optional if the the project require routing module


### Describe alternatives you've considered
This recommendation only apply for SPA.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add modules folder " (#15778)

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update

- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```
schematics

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
While the original purpose of schematics is to provide scaffolding for node.js projects, they can also be used to set up scaffolding for non-javascript projects that happen to use node based tools.  In this case, installing packages locally doesn't make sense, whereas installing tools globally can be extremely useful.  In particular, I'm working on some schematics to set up [antora](https://gitlab.com/antora/antora) projects and installing antora globally is pretty much a necessary feature.  Rather than including a customized copy of the node-package task I think it makes sense to enhance the built-in task.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Enhance the schematics node-package task with a global flag.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
I can package this with my schematics, but this seems like a generally useful feature.

Issues.Title: [dragDrop] On strict movement when dropping outside cdkDropList
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

There is one problem with this, because of some action after dragging on cdkDragDrop.

<action>

1. Drag the item.
2. Go through the drop zone.
3. Drop outside the drop zone.

In the case of dragDrop in angular / cdk, when dropping outside the drop zone, the item moves to the last drop zone where the item was entered.

![cdk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4124275/66533466-f19b3280-eb4d-11e9-8b2d-ab99a3024761.gif)


In the dragula, apart from entering the drop zone, it returns to its original state when dropped outside the drop zone.

![dragula](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4124275/66533465-f1029c00-eb4d-11e9-9c01-f486d3d53e5b.gif)

Therefore, it would be nice to provide an strict method of returning to angular / cdk dragdrop as an option.

Please let me know if there is a way around this.

thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[dragDrop] On strict movement when dropping outside cdkDropList" (#17351)

Issues.Title: feat(material/autocomplete/testing): polish harness API
Issues.Body:
Adds:
- Ability to search for `MatAutocompleteHarness` based on `value`
- Ability to filter `getOptions` with `OptionHarnessFilters`
- Ability to filter `getOptionGroups` with `OptionGroupHarnessFilters`
- Ability to select an option directly, without having to get the option harness

Removes:
- `MatAutocompleteHarness#getAttribute` (prefer more focused APIs)
- `MatAutocompleteHarness#getPanel` (want to avoid returning `TestElement`, prefer more focused APIs)
- `MatAutocompleteHarness#isPanelVisible` (combined into `isOpen`)

Renames:
- `MatAutocompleteHarness#getText` --> `MatAutocompleteHarness#getValue`

Issues.Title: fix(tabs): not picking up indirect descendant tabs in ivy
Issues.Body:
In ViewEngine `ContentChildren` would pick up indirect descendant items, as long as another directive wasn't matched along the way. This allowed for tabs to be wrapped inside something like an `ng-container`. With Ivy `ContentChildren` is a little more strict and it only works on direct descendants.

These changes turn on `descendants` so that we continue supporting the existing use cases from ViewEngine. Note that it needs a bit of extra logic in order to ensure that nested tab groups continue to work as expected.

Fixes #17336.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tabs): not picking up indirect descendant tabs in ivy" (#17346)

* `MatDialogRef.afterOpen` has been replaced with `MatDialogRef.afterOpened`.
* `MatDialogRef.beforeClose` has been replaced with `MatDialogRef.beforeClosed`.
* `MatDialog.afterOpen` has been replaced with `MatDialog.afterOpened`.
* `matDialogAnimations.slideDialog` has been replaced with `matDialogAnimations.dialogContainer`.

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): disabled state not synced on data binding changes
Issues.Body:
Usually we only sync up the drop list ref with the directive right before dragging starts, however if the disabled state is set, it can propagate to the child directives and prevent the user from ever starting a search again. These changes make it so whenever the disable state is set it'll get sync immediately.

Also changes a misleading method name.

Fixes #17325.

Issues.Title: Drag and Drop cdkDropListDisabled odd binding
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bj2u4w (working example)
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4pnl1v (broken example)

When  you the `cdkDropListDisabled ` limit it appears that the next operation isn't setting the disable back to enabled.

In these examples there is a limit on the todo where the todo list should be drag disabed when it has only 1 item and the done list should be drag disabled when the todo list has 6 or more in it. 

Reproduce:
Move all but 1 item from todo and notice that you cannot move the final item out of todo list.
Move 1 from done back to todo. This SHOULD allow you to move an item from todo back to done since the  limit for cdkDropListDisabled  has been removed.
Notice that you cannot move from todo until you move a 3rd into todo. It is fixed if you drop or even just enter the 3rd item into the todo list.

other way of breaking:
Move 6 items into todo and notice you cannot move a 7th item into todo
Move 1 from todo to done. This SHOULD allow you to move an item from done into todo.
Notice you cannot move from done into todo until you reduce the todo count to 4. It is fixed by dropping OR simply entering the done list from todo.
 
#### Expected Behavior

When the cdkDropListDisabled becomes false it should actually let me interact with the draggable list again.


#### Actual Behavior

cdkDropListDisabled is not re-enabling the list after the first operation that makes it false.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and Drop cdkDropListDisabled odd binding" (#17325)

Issues.Title: Two CdkDropListGroups in same page
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do? I'm trying to implement two CdkDropListGroups in the same page. I have the following method for drag and move: `@ViewChild(CdkDropListGroup, null) group: CdkDropListGroup;` ``` dragMoved(e: CdkDragMove) { const point = this.getPointerPositionOnPage(e.event); this.group._items.forEach(dropList => { if (__isInsideDropListClientRect(dropList, point.x, point.y)) { this.activeContainer = dropList; return; } }); } ``` and the following HTML: ```
``` #### What troubleshooting steps have you tried? When i drag items in the second GroupList, the method above ( this.group._items) gets only the first group Elements (dropLists) of the page. How can i link one variable ( @ViewChild(CdkDropListGroup, null) group: CdkDropListGroup ) to the first CdkGroupList and other variable to the second CdkGroupList in the HTML? Thank you! #### Environment - Angular: - CDK/Material: - Browser(s): - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Two CdkDropListGroups in same page" (#17323)
